intro: Cousinia oshtorankuhensis, commonly known as the Oshtorankuh cudweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Iran. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, which bloom during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low moisture conditions. Cousinia oshtorankuhensis is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native environment.
